alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 31 at 3:17AM AKDT until May 31 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Rain transitioning to snow early this morning. Total snow accumulations around 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. Heaviest amounts from Glennallen to the north and northeast. * WHEN...Now through noon AKDT today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Unseasonably late snow fall is expected early this morning as rain and cold temperatures give way to pockets of snowfall. Around 2 to 3 inches of snow from Glennallen north and northeast along the Richardson highway and Tok cutoff are expected. Amounts up to 1 to 2 inches west of Glennallen along the Glen Highway and south of Glennallen along the Richardson Highway. Due to the temperatures being just cold enough for snow, snow accumulations could be either more than expected or stay mostly rain in some parts of the Copper River Basin.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
